item.title: Jenni add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "The first time you see something that you have never seen before, you almost always know right away if you should eat it or run away from it." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Never, never be afraid to do what's right, especially if the well-being of a person or animal is at stake. Society's punishments are small compared to the wounds we inflict on our soul when we look the other way." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "All generalizations are dangerous, even this one." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Life is a storm, my young friend. You will bask in the sunlight one moment, be shattered on the rocks the next. What makes you a man is what you do when that storm comes." -- Alexandre Dumas
